law.catch_line: Mailing of Voter Identification Cards After Precinct Boundaries Are Changed.

text.section:
Sec. 12-24. Mailing of Voter Identification Cards After Precinct Boundaries Are Changed.
Whenever precinct boundaries are changed such that voters must be issued new voter identification cards, the Supervisor of Elections shall, when practicable, mail such cards at least twenty-one (21) days prior to the book closing date for the next countywide election.
